revised_title: Magnetic Observations during a Voyage to the North of Europe and the Coasts of the Arctic Sea in 1870
tldr: Captain Ivan Belavenetz shares his magnetic observations made during a voyage to the North of Europe and the coasts of the Arctic Sea in the summer of 1870. The observations were conducted using a small compass and a Kew Inclinometer, and the data collected was used to study the magnetic declination, inclination, and horizontal and vertical forces in various locations.
